title: Alessandro Dell'Acqua combineA Rochas' long heritage with modernity, Western tradition with Oriental
description:
(27 Sep 2017) ALESSANDRO DELL'ACQUA NODS TO ROCHAS' PAST WHILE DESIGNING WITH AN EYE FOR MODERN
The glamour of silk and ruffles, sequins and brocade were on display at the Rochas Spring-Summer 2018 show Wednesday  (27SEPT2017) evening at the Pavillon Ledoyen, steps from the Champs-Elysées.
The show, all skirts and dresses, combined Rochas' long heritage (the house dates from 1925) with modernity, Western tradition with Orientalism. 
Volume was key, featuring big ruffles that moved to different parts of the body, from high on the back to low on the waist. Fabrics were also important and "super rich," in the words of designer Alessandro Dell'Acqua. 
There were brocades, jacquards, thick embroidery of sequins, Oriental flowers, silvers, royal purple silks and even a jacquard from an old Japanese kimono. Some were reversible, so that two apparently completely different dresses were actually made of the same material, inside out.
"I looked a lot at the old Rochas," said Dell'Acqua after the show, "but I wanted a new modernity."


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/a091743c79fdf4f66c44632d6967167a 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
